respStmt.resp: Contributed data based on various published and unpublished sources

sourceDesc.p: This is a born-digital edition created through custom XSLT from a OmniOutliner 3 XML file on 3 March 2014.

refsDecl.p: Bibliographic notes are marked with the ref element. This element carries the attribute type identifying the source of the reference – usually a reference managing software. ref type="SenteCitationID" identifies Sente as the reference manager. The target attribute contains the placeholder tag used by the software identified in type to refer to an individual reference or a group of references.

revisionDesc.change: Fixed the mark-up of sources by transforming everything to bibl type="pandoc" with the BibTex Key as the value.
Grouped biblStruct by periodical and gathered all relevant events under this new single biblStruct. Sorted list by title.

Added references to local authority file (/BachUni/BachBibliothek/GitHub/OpenArabicPE/authority-files/data/tei/bibliography_OpenArabicPE-periodicals.TEIP5.xml) and to OCLC (WorldCat) IDs to titless without such references based on biblStructs mentioned in the authority file (bibliography).

Added references to local authority file (/BachUni/BachBibliothek/GitHub/OpenArabicPE/authority-files/data/tei/bibliography_OpenArabicPE-periodicals.TEIP5.xml) and to OCLC (WorldCat) IDs to titless without such references based on biblStructs mentioned in the authority file (bibliography).

Added references to local authority file (/BachUni/BachBibliothek/GitHub/OpenArabicPE/authority-files/data/tei/bibliography_OpenArabicPE-periodicals.TEIP5.xml) and to OCLC (WorldCat) IDs to titless without such references based on biblStructs mentioned in the authority file (bibliography).

Added references to local authority file (/BachUni/BachBibliothek/GitHub/OpenArabicPE/authority-files/data/tei/gazetteer_OpenArabicPE.TEIP5.xml) and to GeoNames IDs to placeNames without such references based on places mentioned in the authority file.
added data from Project Jarāʾid and other sources
All ref type="SenteCitationID" have been automatically formatted using information from the library of primary sources.
Added numerous rows based on readings during the last two years.
Changed all note with type ='SenteCitationID' to ref elements
corrected the faulty attribute values of corresp on note elements: the internal spaces in Sente IDs were replaced with "+" and the separating ";" has been replaced with whitespaces
Created by automatic conversion from OmniOutliner

first issue of this weekly, published by Naʿūm al-Bustānī and Wadīʿ Afram al-Bustānī

event.label: P
event.note: Aḥmad ʿIzzat Bey and Aḥmad ʿArafī Bey obtain the official permit to publish a bilingual weekly (Wednesday) in Damascus.

event.label: S
event.note: permit to resume its publication in Arabic and Ottoman after being shut down for some months

event.label: PR
event.note: permit to resume its publication in Arabic and Ottoman after being shut down for some months

event.label: P
event.note: Muḥammad Ḥayrī Efendi Shabīb zade obtained the permit to publish a newspaper under the title of Dimashq . The first issue was pulished on 1909-02-20

event.label: RP
event.note: continuing from al-Fatā al-ʿArabī

event.label: CP
event.note: There will be no September issue either. publication will recommence after the war in Europe

event.label: P
event.note: ʿAbd al-Qādir Khaṭīb zade from Damascus obtained the permit to publish the weekly newspaper Faṣl al-Khiṭāb and to open the al-Maṭbaʿa al-ʿUmūmiyya printing press

event.label: P
event.note: bi-weekly published by ʿIsā Efendi Dāwud al-ʿIsā

event.label: RP
event.note: The first issue after the suspension is available

event.label: Trial
event.note: Trial of the owner came to a conclusion

event.label: BI
event.note: The paper from Falba is banned from import with reference to Art. 35 of the printing law

event.label: RP
event.note: in reaction to ban by the imperial educational war divan, the newspaper Tanẓīmāt al continues publication as Iṣlāḥāt
The editor arrived in Damascus

event.label: P
event.note: Muḥammad Mīdānī Efendi did what was necessary to obtain a permit for publishing an Arabic-speaking newspaper in Damascus under the title of Kashf al-Ḥijāb . He did so in compliance with the law on printing presses, which is enforced by the ministry of gendarmerie

event.label: P
event.note: the owner of the librairie universelle Amīn Efendi al-Khūrī obtained the concession to publish Kawkab al-Sharq in Beirut

event.label: P
event.note: bi-lingual, Ottoman and Arabic newspaper published by Maḥmūd Efendi Zakkī
First issue arrived in Beirut
Arabic newspaper published biweekly by Muḥammad Saʿīd Efendi Tawḥalī zade

event.label: S
event.note: Suspended for an offensive article

event.label: RP
event.note: continuing from Ṣadā al-Mufīd

event.label: S
event.note: Paper closed down, reappeared as al-Fatā al-ʿArabī within a few days.

event.label: S
event.note: No reasons given. Lisān's gap in publication between #52 ( 15 Apr ) and #53 ( 13 May )

event.label: S
event.note: No reasons given. Lisān's gap of publication of 3 numbers at some point between 23 Dec and 13 Jan .

event.label: W
event.note: False and exaggerated news about Lebanon

event.label: W
event.note: For a report on the Shūf

event.label: S
event.note: for news from Egypt that could stir the minds ( takhdīsh al-adhhān )

event.label: S
event.note: Banned from publication for one month for reports on the Tzar's journey in #928 of 13 Jan 1887

event.label: S
event.note: Harming the public interest in #1160 of 6 May (thrown out of court, 9 Sep 1889 ). The first number after the ban speaks of 2 months only (between #1168 and #1169), but does not elaborate on the reasons

event.label: S
event.note: the Ministry of the Interior issued an indefinite ban against the paper. Missing from the AUB collection, but the numbering indicates a ban of 5 months prior to March 1892

event.label: PR
event.note: The Ministry of the Interior issued a permit to resume publication, which began on 24 October . No reason given.

event.label: W
event.note: Violation of the censor's warning

event.label: S
event.note: Suspended from 1895-01-19 onwards for the publication of false news

event.note: Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law.

event.label: S
event.note: Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law. No gap in publication dates after #3879 ( 22 Nov )

event.label: W
event.note: Publication of an article which violated the principles of the Press Law

event.label: S
event.note: Publication of articles which violated the basic principle of the Press Law. publication gap of ten days, between #4446 ( 6 Nov ) and #4447 ( 15 Nov ). Henceforth they have to comply with the basic principles [of the press law].

event.label: S
event.note: For an unnamed reason. Corresponding gap of a total of 12 weeks at some point between #4741 ( 23 Dec 1904 ) and #4883 ( 1 Sep 1905 ).

event.label: Raid
event.note: Numerous raids of its offices in connection with their opposition to the new press law

event.label: Trial
event.note: Public prosecutor filed charges for having published false corruption claims

event.label: CP
event.note: Lisān al-Ḥālhad been published on smaller paper for some issues due to the hardships of the current situation, but even this measure won't sustain the paper, which will cease publication

event.label: PR
event.note: Permit to recommence publication

event.label: S
event.note: the imperial educational war divan (*al-dīwān al-ḥarb al-ʿarafī*) banned the newspaper Lātūrkī

event.label: BI
event.note: The paper from Paris is banned from import with reference to Art. 35 of the printing law

event.label: P
event.note: Permit was given to ʿAbd al-Qādir Badrān to publish the weekly newspaper Mawārid al-Ḥikma in Damascus

event.label: P
event.note: ʿAbd al-Qādir Badrān Efendi obtained the permit to publish the weekly newspaper Mawārid al-Ḥikma in Damascus.

event.label: P
event.note: Salīm ʿAnḥūrī received the permit to open a printing press and publish this paper
we received the first issue of the newspaper Mirāʾat al-Sharq published in Egypt by Salīm Efendi ʿAnḥūrī . the director of publication is Amīn Efendi Nāṣīf

event.note: The permit to publish a newspaper was sent to Ṣāliḥ Efendi, municipal doctor and member of the medical association in Damascus

event.label: P
event.note: Ṭāhir Efendi, former director of education, obtained the permit to publish an Ottoman, Arabic, and French-speaking newspaper in Damascus and Syria and to open a printing press under the title of Riyāḥāt al-Afkār

event.label: P
event.note: ruġbetis a new political newspaper in Ottoman turkish published in the capital of the Bulgarian Imāret by its owner and director Aḥmad Ḥāfiẓ Efendi . The first issue arrived in Beirut

event.label: P
event.note: Khālid Efendi from Kars obtained the permit to publish a bi-lingual Ottoman Arabic newspaper under the title Ruḥta al-Shām in Damascus

illustrated paper published by Nūrī Efendi Fantamnā

event.label: BI
event.note: Council of ministers banned the import into the Ottoman Empire. It must also be noted that Shams would not be an Arabic title
Weekly; published in Tripoli by its owner and responsible director ʿAbd al-Raḥmān Efendi ʿIzz al-Dīn . first issue arrived in Beirut.

Bilingual (Arabic, Ottoman) paper, published thrice a week on Sat, Mon, and Wed in Damascus by Muṣṭafā Shawqī Efendi .

event.label: Trial
event.note: the editor of the Albanian newspaper al-bāshqīm was arrested for claims he had made over the existence of books in Albanian language and scripture

event.label: RP
event.note: the first issue of the new newspaper al-Dustūr , published in Jaffa to replace Filasṭīn , which has been suspended, arrived in Damascus. The responsible director is Jamīl Efendi al-Khālidī , the editor in chief is Yūsuf Efendi al-ʿĪsā

event.note: al-Intiqādwas warned by the al-Majlis al-ʿArafī / al-ʿUrfī (educational council?) for having published something violating the personal rights of Muḥammad ʿUbayd Allah , the Nāʾib of Izmir and owner of the newspaper al-ʿArab

event.label: S
event.note: the al-Dīwān al-ʿUrfī in Constantinople just banned (*ʿaṭala*) the newspaper al-Intiqād from publication due to the owner ʿAbd al-Razzāq Efendi al-Baghdādī not having had a permission to publish a newspaper of any name.

a new weekly newspaper published in Jidda by the concessionary Rāghib Efendi Muṣṭafā Tawkal . The editor is Adīb Efendi Dāwud Harārī . the first issue arrived in Damascus

event.note: Permit for republication after suspension for unmentioned reasons granted by the Vali of Beirut on 22 Kan I 1323

event.label: P
event.note: newspaper published by Aḥmad Efendi Sulṭān
Daily, published by ʿAbd al-Ghannī al-ʿUraysī in Beirut

event.label: Trial
event.note: Numerous trials and libel cases. Fiscal penalties

event.label: S
event.note: Paper closed down, reappeared as Ṣadā al-Mufīd within a few days.

event.label: S
event.note: Banned and offices raided

event.label: P
event.note: published on Sat and Tue, owner is the teacher Shaykh Aḥmad al-ʿAṭṭār, editor is Adīb Efendi Naẓmī
First issue arrived in Damascus

event.label: P
event.note: In compliance with the Vali of Syria, Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī Efendi from Damascus obtained the permit to open a printing press and to publish a daily newspaper under the title of al-Muqtabas
Daily in Damascus by Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī

event.label: S
event.note: For publishing a treasonous article. This also resulted in a Trial of Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī. He was acquitted in late December

event.label: RP
event.note: After Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī was cleared from the alleged treason, all al-Umma reverted back to its old name al-Muqtabas .

event.label: Trial
event.note: Arrest of Aḥmad Kurd ʿAlī; attempted arrest of Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī

event.label: S
event.note: For publishing a qaṣīda by Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Uskūbī. Arrest of Aḥmad Kurd ʿAlī; attempted arrest of Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī

event.label: RP
event.note: After almost four months al-Muqtabas resumed publication

event.label: S
event.note: Ceased publication for a week and was continued as al-Qabas .

event.label: Trial
event.note: Aḥmad Kurd ʿAlī, the responsible editor of al-Muqtabas, was sentenced to one month imprisonment and the payment of £T 5 for the publication of fabricated news

event.label: RP
event.note: Resumed publication under the old name

event.label: S
event.note: information on a group of feminists in Constantinople opposed to the ḥijāb

event.label: CP
event.note: Ceased publication until May 1877 due to a lack of subscribers

event.label: RP
event.note: Ceased publication until May 1877 due to a lack of subscribers

event.label: W
event.note: A controversy about Voltaire involving personal invective and incitement to public disturbances
New weekly published in Beirut by Jirjī Efendi Shāḥin ʿAṭiyya

event.label: Trial
event.note: Salīm Sarkīs, the owner of al-Mushīr did not attend a session of his trial (in Beirut?). Had been sentenced to one year in prison and the payment of £T20 by the ibtidāʾiyya court

event.label: P
event.note: First Arabic-Ottoman newspaper after the restoration of the constitution

event.label: BI
event.note: Banned from import into the Ottoman Empire. Reports on violent clashes in Syria

event.label: PI
event.note: orders to import al-Muʾayyad, the largest Islamic newspaper in Egypt, into the Ottoman Empire, which had hitherto been prohibited.

event.label: BI
event.note: Ban on import into the Ottoman Empire
illustrated monthly journal published by ʿAwwaḍ Efendi Wāṣif . Issue 4 arrived in Beirut

event.label: P
event.note: Published by Khalī Efendi Baydis

event.label: Trial
event.note: the owner of al-Nafīr , Jūrjī Ḥanāniyā Efendi Ḥabīb [sic], is prosecuted for the opening article in #370 of al-Nafīr published on 16 Mārt 1326 M under the title "man sall Sayf al-Baghī qatal bihi", which was a reply to an article in al-Quds

event.label: Trial
event.note: the owner of al-Nafīr is in prison

event.label: S
event.note: For not having an irāde for publication and printing a telegram in #46 that was similarly reproduced by Lisān al-Ḥāl and others without objections from the censor. After eight months the paper got a new permit as a religious newspaper, henceforth prohibiting any political news

event.label: PR
event.note: After eight months the paper got a new permit as a religious newspaper, henceforth prohibiting any political news

event.label: Trial
event.note: Jirjī Efendi ʿAwaḍ, director of the newspaper al-Naṣīr , was sentenced to six months imprisonment for publishing this newspaper in contravention of the law

event.label: P
event.note: Adīb Efendi Adabī zade obtained the permit to publish an Ottoman and Arabic speaking daily newspaper under the title of al-Nāqid al-Sūrī , which he had applied for

event.label: RP
event.note: 100 issues of al-Qabas continued al-Muqtabas ' counting

event.label: P
event.note: Received first issue in Beirut

event.label: RP
event.note: after some 12 years this newspaper is again published. This long absence was a result of its concessionary Muḥammad ʿĀrif Bey Efendi having moved to Constantinople. The new concessionary is Muḥammad Efendi al-Ḥusaynī, director is Muḥammad Efendi Sahrīf. the first issue was published.

event.label: Trial
event.note: Accused of lies and false news

event.label: P
event.note: ʿAbdullah Efendi from Damascus obtained the permit to open a printing press ( al-Ḥikma ) and to publish two newspapers, al-Ḥikma and al-Rafīq , in his hometown

event.label: P
event.note: Thrice a week.
The first issues of this daily newspaper were published by Ṭaha Efendi al-Mudawwar

event.label: Trial
event.note: Accused of lies and false news
Weekly newspaper, first issue arrived in Damascus

event.label: P
event.note: Thrice a month (hijrī) by Bashīr Efendi bin Fatḥallah
monthly journal published by ʿAbd al-Bāqī Efendi al-Darūbī and ʿAbd al-Karīm Efendi Ṣabbāgh . First issue arrived in Beirut.

event.label: P
event.note: New weekly newspaper in Aleppo

event.label: S
event.note: Authorities banned the publication of al-Shahbāʾ

event.label: S
event.note: An offensive expression

event.label: P
event.note: Jirjī Efendi Matā from Acre, teacher at the Greek Orthodox school in Damascus, obtained the imperial permit to publish a fortnightly scientific journal in Damascus.
1st and 3rd issues were published

event.label: P
event.note: The owner of the concession for the al-Ṣalāḥ printing press in Damascus, Ḥabīb Barhūm Efendi, obtained the permit for an Ottoman and Arabic speaking newspaper under the title al-Sharq after he had handed in all the required stuff
first number of the daily al-Sharq arrived from Damascus.

event.label: P
event.note: three times a week

event.label: P
event.note: Amīn Efendi Tarakci obtained the permit to publish a weekly, Ottoman and Arabic speaking newspaper under the title of al-Shām in Damascus

event.label: P
event.note: Permit for the newspaper al-Shām , to be published in Damascus by Muṣṭafā Wāṣif Efendi

event.label: P
event.note: announcing the publication of the new newspaper al-Shām . Muṣṭafā Wāṣif is the proprietor and Adīb Naẓmī the editor and director.

event.label: S
event.note: banned for unknown reasons for 4 months

event.label: PR
event.note: first issue after a ban of 4 months

event.label: CP
event.note: ceased publication soon after Young Turk Revolution

event.label: P
event.note: Ḥayrī Bey, graduate of the teachers' college, obtained the permit to publish the Turkish-speaking daily newspaper Tekemmül

event.label: P
event.note: Reports from Constantinople on this new newspaper

event.label: P
event.note: thrice a week

event.label: RP
event.note: Republished 2 months. No explanation

event.label: P
event.note: al-Taqaddum is published with a new layout

event.label: W
event.note: No reason provided

event.label: S
event.note: Insult to the sultan

event.label: S
event.note: insulting the Druze community in #123

event.label: S
event.note: insulting the Druze community, repeated punishment, imperial order

event.label: W
event.note: false reports on the cordon sanitaire around Beirut in #83

event.label: W
event.note: Upsetting news takhdīsh al-adhhān . over article in #122

event.label: S
event.note: False news that incited the people ( tahyīj al-afkār ) to riot

event.label: RP
event.note: Resumed publication

event.label: P
event.note: daily published in Beirut by Iskandar Efendi Khūrī and Khalīl Efendi Zayniyah

event.label: PR
event.note: Aḥmad Kurd ʿAlī obtained the permit to publish the daily al-Umma in Damascus. Continuing from al-Muqtabas .
Aḥmad Kurd ʿAlī published the first issue of al-Umma in Damascus. Continuing from al-Muqtabas .

event.label: P
event.note: New daily published by Shiblī Efendi Mallāṭ , Najīb Efendi al-Shawshānī , and Fīlīks Efendi Fāris

event.label: CP
event.note: ceased publication due to the current situation

event.label: P
event.note: The first two issues arrived in Beirut

event.label: S
event.note: Lisān al-Ḥāl reported the paper was shut down while al-Iqbāl wrote it received #18 in the mail
monthly journal published by al-Amīr Nasīb Efendi Maḥmūd Shihāb , Wadīʿ Efendi Naṣṣār , and Fāḍil Efendi al-Jamāl . First isuue arrived in Beirut.
weekly newspaper was established in Tripoli by Muḥammad ʿAlī Efendi al-Bārūdī . First issue arrived in Beirut

event.label: P
event.note: Nāṣīf Bey obtained a permit for the Arabic-speaking weekly al-ʿAṣr al-Jadīd in Damascus

event.label: BI
event.note: Ban on import into the Ottoman Empire

event.label: W
event.note: For a report on the Shūf
New monthly

event.label: CP
event.note: ceased publication after the third volume

event.label: S
event.note: Indefinetly banned from publication for some expressions concerning the Tsar of Russia

event.label: S
event.note: al-Ḥaqīqa was indefinitely suspended from publication by decision of the al-Dīwān al-ʿUrfī.

event.label: P
event.note: weekly

event.label: P
event.note: ʿAbdullah Efendi from Damascus obtained the permit to open a printing press ( al-Ḥikma ) and to publish two newspapers, al-Ḥikma and al-Rafīq , in his hometown

event.label: P
event.note: legal journal

event.label: P
event.note: weekly

event.label: P
event.note: fortnightly journal

event.label: P
event.note: weekly paper published every Wed by the concessionary Muṣṭafā Rushdī Efendi al-Ḥumṣī

event.label: P
event.note: religious catholic newspapers published by Father Jibrāʾīl Qarqamāz

event.label: BI
event.note: Vali received orders for the director of education that no Egyptian newspapers are to be allowed into the province

event.label: S
event.note: for news from Egypt

event.label: W
event.note: repeated publishing of uncensored material by al-Miṣbāḥ or any other paper will be punished with ban

event.label: W
event.note: Warning to all newspapers to denounce Russia with one voice

event.label: PI
event.note: The province of Beirut allowed the import of hitherto banned papers

event.label: PR
event.note: received permit to resume publication

event.label: RP
event.note: the newspaper Shahrāʾ published an article on the dīwān al-ḥarb al-ʿarafī and was subsequently banned from publication. The next day it was published under a new name: ʿalimdār

event.label: S
event.note: Publication of articles which violated the basic principle of the Press Law

event.label: W
event.note: Henceforth they have to comply with the basic principles [of the press law]

event.label: P
event.note: Permit for Ḥawādis̱-i Müḳtebese to be published in Damascus granted to Muṣṭafā Wāṣif Efendi. Publication interval not specified

event.label: Trial
event.note: Ḥilmī Efendi al-Fatiyānī, responsible director of " Ḥaṭṭ bi-l-Kharaj ", informed us that the judiciary of Damascus indicted ʿĀrif Efendi al-Habl , the owner of said paper and ordered him to leave the province. the MoJ etc. decided that local authorities have no authority in this matter
The first issue was published by Sajʿān Efendi ʿĀrij

event.label: RP
event.note: continuing from al-Mufīd

event.label: S
event.note: Paper closed down, reappeared as Lisān al-ʿArab within a few days.

event.label: P
event.note: Three times a week by Ḥikmat Nāẓim and Ibrāhīm Khalīl

event.label: RP
event.note: Recommenced publication in Arabic and Turkish after some unspecified period

event.label: S
event.note: suspended for slander

event.label: S
event.note: in reaction to ban by the imperial educational war divan, the newspaper Tanẓīmāt al continues publication as Iṣlāḥāt

event.label: S
event.note: For errors, perhaps because of a slip of the pen

event.label: S
event.note: No reason given

event.label: S
event.note: Orders for suspension from Istanbul for an article in #517, 15 Tam 1903, that originally passed the censor

event.label: S
event.note: For an unnamed reason

event.label: PR
event.note: Permit to resume publication

div.head: Legend
div.p: This data set is based on the table of suspensions, bans, and warnings provided by Cioeta, "Ottoman Censorship," 1979:182-185, which covered the years 1878-1908. I augmented his data with my own readings, checked for corresponding gaps in publication when possible, corrected the dating, and added information on the years 1908-1914.
This file has been converted from the original table and as of 2022-02-13 not all data has made it. Particularly the duration of suspensions is still missing.
The formatting of sources needs work and Cioeta's references to Thamarāt al-Funūn need to be checked for dating, as he confused sharqī and gharbī calendars.
div.note: 1Dates provide the date of the warning, if known. Otherwise they represent the date of publication for the periodical they were printed in. The dates are always different from Cioeta's as he confused the Ottoman fiscal ( mālī ) or Julian calendars for Gregorian reckoning.
5Sources abbreviated as "TF" ( Thamarāt al-Funūn ) and "Iq" ( al-Iqbāl ) were solely provided by Cioeta

6Cioeta sometimes chose to present the officially designated period of suspension, while on other occasions, he presented the actual period of suspension. Here, I generally opted for the officially decreed period of suspension.
